result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert A. Lopez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert A. Lopez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE must enroll and successfully complete a domestic abuse counseling program
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to any other sentence in being.
All prior monetary obligations that are not paid will be converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 10:32 am - Court calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Robert A. Lopez in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge O'Melia appears by video along with court reporter.  Court questions DE regarding if he is OK with Judge appearing by video.  Parties have received and acknowledged revocation packet.  DA states recommendations.  Comments by Atty Snyder.  Comments by DE.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court orders DE to 90 days jail, concurrent to any other in being.  Convert all prior monetary obligations not paid to a civil judgment.   Adj 10:44 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 7, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:24 am - Court calls cases 16CM66 and 16CM67 and states appearances.  Defendant Robert A. Lopez via video from prison with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appearing in person.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE about appearing in person.  DE waives right to appear in person.  DA states agreement.  Court orders Ct 1 in 16CM67 amended to ordinance 403-3 dc.  DE pleads No Contest to amended count and is found guilty.  Court orders fine of $295 and $65 SBDA.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 of 16CM66.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2 of 16CM66, and on motion of DA dismisses Ct 1 in 16CM66 and Ct 2 in 16CM67.  Court imposes on Ct 2, 16CM66:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$100 DOMAB
Enroll and successfully complete a domestic abuse issues counseling. 
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

Appeal rights given.

$360 to be paid by 5/1/17 or CO.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant Robert A. Lopez appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 8/30/16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
